action_space.name: RapportBuilding
action_space.description: Create a safe, non-judgmental environment where the client feels comfortable sharing personal information

micro_actions.name: WarmGreeting
micro_actions.description: Begin session with friendly, welcoming tone and personal acknowledgment

micro_actions.name: NormalizingStatement
micro_actions.description: Validate client's experiences by indicating they are common and understandable

micro_actions.name: EmpathicReflection
micro_actions.description: Mirror client's emotions to show understanding and validation

micro_actions.name: PersonalAcknowledgement
micro_actions.description: Remember and reference previous session content or personal details

action_space.name: AgendaSetting
action_space.goal: Establish clear focus and direction for the session
action_space.description: Collaboratively determine what issues to address during the current session

micro_actions.name: SessionBridge
micro_actions.description: Connect current session to previous session content

micro_actions.name: OpenEndedInquiry
micro_actions.description: Ask what client would like to focus on today

micro_actions.name: PriorityClarification
micro_actions.description: Help client identify most pressing concerns

micro_actions.name: GoalAlignment
micro_actions.description: Connect session focus to broader treatment goals

action_space.name: Assessment
action_space.goal: Gather comprehensive understanding of current concerns
action_space.description: Explore the nature, context, and impact of the client's presenting issues

micro_actions.name: SituationProbing
micro_actions.description: Ask about specific situations where the issue occurs

micro_actions.name: EmotionExploration
micro_actions.description: Inquire about emotional responses and intensity

micro_actions.name: ThoughtIdentification
micro_actions.description: Help client identify automatic thoughts and beliefs

micro_actions.name: BehavioralAnalysis
micro_actions.description: Explore actions and reactions in relevant situations

micro_actions.name: ImpactAssessment
micro_actions.description: Ask about consequences on daily functioning and relationships

action_space.name: CognitiveRestructuring
action_space.goal: Help client identify and modify unhelpful thinking patterns
action_space.description: Challenge cognitive distortions and develop more balanced perspectives

micro_actions.name: ThoughtRecordIntroduction
micro_actions.description: Explain the process of tracking thoughts and emotions

micro_actions.name: EvidenceExamination
micro_actions.description: Explore evidence for and against automatic thoughts

micro_actions.name: AlternativePerspective
micro_actions.description: Generate alternative, more balanced interpretations

micro_actions.name: SocraticQuestioning
micro_actions.description: Use guided discovery to examine thought validity

micro_actions.name: CognitiveReframing
micro_actions.description: Help client restructure thoughts in more adaptive ways

action_space.name: SkillBuilding
action_space.goal: Develop practical coping strategies and behavioral skills
action_space.description: Teach and practice specific techniques to manage emotions and improve functioning

micro_actions.name: Psychoeducation
micro_actions.description: Provide information about relevant psychological concepts

micro_actions.name: TechniqueDemonstration
micro_actions.description: Show how to perform specific coping strategies

micro_actions.name: GuidedPractice
micro_actions.description: Walk client through skill application in session

micro_actions.name: ProblemSolving
micro_actions.description: Collaboratively generate solutions to specific challenges

micro_actions.name: HomeworkAssignment
micro_actions.description: Assign between-session practice of new skills

action_space.name: EmotionalProcessing
action_space.goal: Facilitate adaptive emotional expression and regulation
action_space.description: Help client safely experience, express, and understand emotions

micro_actions.name: EmotionLabeling
micro_actions.description: Help client identify and name specific emotions

micro_actions.name: BodyAwareness
micro_actions.description: Guide attention to physical sensations associated with emotions

micro_actions.name: Validation
micro_actions.description: Acknowledge and accept emotional experiences without judgment

micro_actions.name: EmotionTolerance
micro_actions.description: Support client in staying with difficult emotions

micro_actions.name: RegulationStrategy
micro_actions.description: Introduce techniques for managing emotional intensity

action_space.name: ProgressReview
action_space.goal: Evaluate treatment progress and adjust approach as needed
action_space.description: Assess what's working, identify barriers, and modify treatment plan

micro_actions.name: ChangeRecognition
micro_actions.description: Highlight improvements and progress made

micro_actions.name: BarrierIdentification
micro_actions.description: Explore obstacles to implementing strategies

micro_actions.name: GoalReassessment
micro_actions.description: Review and adjust treatment goals as needed

micro_actions.name: StrategyEvaluation
micro_actions.description: Discuss effectiveness of current approaches

micro_actions.name: PlanAdjustment
micro_actions.description: Modify treatment plan based on progress and feedback

action_space.name: SessionClosure
action_space.goal: Ensure smooth transition out of therapeutic space
action_space.description: Summarize session content, reinforce learning, and prepare for between-session work

micro_actions.name: KeyTakeaways
micro_actions.description: Summarize main insights and learning points

micro_actions.name: HomeworkReview
micro_actions.description: Clarify between-session assignments and expectations

micro_actions.name: CopingAnticipation
micro_actions.description: Discuss potential challenges and coping strategies

micro_actions.name: NextSessionPreview
micro_actions.description: Briefly outline focus for following session

micro_actions.name: SupportiveClosing
micro_actions.description: End with encouraging, validating statements

Conversation_states.Description: The quality of the collaborative relationship and bond between therapist and client. Strong alliance is crucial for treatment adherence and effectiveness.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Poor alliance, distrust, disengagement) to 1 (Strong, trusting, collaborative partnership)

Conversation_states.Description: The client's level of active participation, involvement, and openness in the session. Low engagement may indicate resistance or lack of readiness.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Passive, withdrawn, monosyllabic) to 1 (Highly active, participatory, self-disclosing)

Conversation_states.Description: The intensity of the client's expressed emotion (e.g., sadness, anxiety, anger). Needs to be managed to be productive without becoming overwhelming.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Flat affect, numbed, dissociated) to 1 (Highly dysregulated, overwhelmed, distraught)

Conversation_states.Description: The client's ability to recognize and understand the connections between thoughts, feelings, and behaviors. Fundamental for cognitive restructuring.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (No insight, externalizing blame) to 1 (Clear insight, can independently identify cognitive distortions)

Conversation_states.Description: The specificity and concrete understanding of the problem(s) being discussed. Vague problems are harder to target therapeutically.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Vague, diffuse, 'everything is wrong') to 1 (Specific, well-defined, concrete examples)

Conversation_states.Description: The client's readiness and willingness to engage in change efforts, aligned with the Stages of Change model.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Precontemplation, resistant to change) to 1 (Action/Maintenance, taking active steps)

Conversation_states.Description: The client's degree of optimism about the possibility of improvement. Hopelessness is a risk factor and a target for intervention.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Hopeless, pessimistic, defeatist) to 1 (Hopeful, optimistic, sees a path forward)

Conversation_states.Description: The degree to which the conversation remains focused on therapeutically relevant topics versus tangential or avoidant material.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (Unfocused, highly tangential, avoidant) to 1 (Highly focused, on-topic, productive)

Conversation_states.Description: The client's understanding and ability to apply CBT techniques (e.g., thought records, behavioral activation) both in-session and between sessions.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (No understanding or application) to 1 (Mastery, independently and effectively applies skills)

Conversation_states.Description: The assessed level of immediate risk of harm to self or others. This is a critical variable that overrides all other therapeutic tasks if elevated.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (No indicated risk) to 1 (Imminent, high-risk, requires crisis intervention)

knowledge_graph.description: The central entity representing the individual receiving therapy, including core demographic and treatment information
The primary issues or symptoms that initially brought the patient to therapy, with severity and duration
Specific, measurable objectives established collaboratively for therapy outcomes
Individual therapy meetings with date, focus, interventions used, and progress notes
Fundamental, deeply held assumptions about self, others, and the world that shape thinking patterns
Immediate, often unconscious thoughts that arise in specific situations and trigger emotional responses
Recurring emotional experiences, their triggers, intensity, frequency, and duration
Habitual actions, avoidance behaviors, coping strategies, and daily functioning patterns
Significant past or current events that impact the patient's psychological well-being
Important interpersonal connections including family, friends, romantic partners, and work relationships
Techniques and strategies the patient uses or is learning to manage distress and improve functioning
Measurable indicators of improvement such as symptom scales, functional assessments, and subjective ratings
Elements that increase vulnerability to psychological distress or impede treatment progress
Strengths, resources, and supports that enhance resilience and facilitate recovery
